collection-cli-app.title: Build a CLI Collection App
collection-cli-app.description: Learn to store, display, and persist data through building a practical command-line application

contexts.list-create-empty: Every adventurer needs an inventory to carry their loot.
contexts.list-append-dynamic: Add a newly found item to your inventory.
contexts.list-in-check: Check if you already have this item before picking it up.
contexts.dict-create-values: Items have stats like damage and rarity.
contexts.for-loop-list: Display all items in your inventory.
contexts.enumerate-basic: Number your items so you can select them by index.
contexts.while-loop-basic: Keep fighting until the enemy is defeated.
contexts.list-comp-filter-dynamic: Filter your inventory to show only rare items.
contexts.list-comp-basic: Create a list of item names from your inventory.
contexts.dict-comp-basic: Create a lookup table of item names to damage values.
contexts.context-intro: Save your inventory to a file so progress persists.
contexts.file-read-basic: Load your saved game from a file.
contexts.file-write-basic: Write your current stats to the save file.
contexts.try-except-basic: Handle the case where the save file doesn't exist.
contexts.try-except-specific: Catch the error when an item slot is empty.
contexts.function-basic: Create a function to calculate total inventory weight.
contexts.function-args: Create a function that adds an item with a given quantity.
contexts.if-else-basic: Check if the player has enough gold to buy an item.
contexts.elif-chain: Determine item quality: legendary, rare, or common.
contexts.class-basic: Create an Item class to represent inventory items.
contexts.class-method: Add a method to calculate item value based on rarity.

contexts.list-append-dynamic: Pick up an item and add it to inventory.
contexts.list-in-check: Check if the player already has this item.
contexts.dict-create-values: Track item properties like quantity and weight.
contexts.for-loop-list: Display all items in the player's inventory.
contexts.enumerate-basic: Number items for the use/drop menu.
contexts.list-comp-filter-dynamic: Show only items that can be equipped.
contexts.context-intro: Save the game state to continue later.

contexts.list-create-empty: Every music app needs a playlist to store tracks.
contexts.list-append-dynamic: Add a track to the current playlist.
contexts.list-in-check: Check if a track is already in the playlist.
contexts.dict-create-values: Tracks have metadata like artist and duration.
contexts.for-loop-list: Display all tracks in the playlist.
contexts.enumerate-basic: Number tracks so users can select by position.
contexts.while-loop-basic: Keep playing tracks until the playlist ends.
contexts.list-comp-filter-dynamic: Filter to show only tracks by a specific artist.
contexts.list-comp-basic: Create a list of track titles from the playlist.
contexts.dict-comp-basic: Create a lookup table of track titles to durations.
contexts.context-intro: Save the playlist so it persists between sessions.
contexts.file-read-basic: Load your saved playlist from a file.
contexts.file-write-basic: Write the current playlist to a file.
contexts.try-except-basic: Handle the case where the playlist file is missing.
contexts.try-except-specific: Catch the error when trying to play an empty playlist.
contexts.function-basic: Create a function to calculate total playlist duration.
contexts.function-args: Create a function that adds a track with a given artist.
contexts.if-else-basic: Check if a track is longer than 5 minutes.
contexts.elif-chain: Categorize track length: short, medium, or long.
contexts.class-basic: Create a Track class to represent songs.
contexts.class-method: Add a method to format track duration as mm:ss.

contexts.list-create-empty: Create an empty playlist for the user.
contexts.list-append-dynamic: Add a song to the playlist.
contexts.list-in-check: Check if a song is already in the playlist.
contexts.dict-create-values: Store song details like artist and duration.
contexts.for-loop-list: Display all songs in the playlist.
contexts.list-comp-filter-dynamic: Find songs by a specific artist.
contexts.context-intro: Save the playlist to a file.

contexts.list-create-empty: Start your recipe book with an empty collection.
contexts.list-append-dynamic: Add a new recipe to your collection.
contexts.list-in-check: Check if you already have this recipe.
contexts.dict-create-values: Store recipe details like servings and prep time.
contexts.context-intro: Save your recipe book to disk.

contexts.list-create-empty: Start with an empty shopping cart for the user.
contexts.list-append-dynamic: Add an item the customer wants to buy.
contexts.list-in-check: Check if an item is already in the cart before adding.
contexts.dict-create-values: Track item details like quantity and price.
contexts.for-loop-list: Display all items in the cart.
contexts.enumerate-basic: Number items so the user can remove by number.
contexts.list-comp-filter-dynamic: Show only items above a certain price.
contexts.context-intro: Save the cart to resume shopping later.

contexts.list-create-empty: Every task manager needs somewhere to store tasks.
contexts.list-append-dynamic: Add a new task the user typed in.
contexts.list-in-check: Check if a task already exists before adding it.
contexts.dict-create-values: Tasks need more than just a name - add status too.
contexts.for-loop-list: Display all tasks so the user can see what's pending.
contexts.enumerate-basic: Number the tasks so users can reference them.
contexts.context-intro: Save tasks to a file so they persist between sessions.
